intro: Restio curvibracteatus, commonly known as the spiral restio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Restionaceae family and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white flowers. It thrives in coastal and sandy environments, often found in dune systems. Its unique spiral arrangement of leaves gives it a distinctive and ornamental appearance.
